channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Two Things that Make Developers Happy - Mid-to-Senior Perl Developer in London
item.description: Not everyoneâ€™s like me. Perhaps nobodyâ€™s like me. But when it comes to enjoying programming jobs, and particularly when it comes to enjoying Perl programming jobs, there are two things that are needed to make me happy that I suspect resonate with most other career developers.

item.title: The Story of MÃ¤ike - Senior Perl developer in finance
item.description: Many (many) years ago I used to work for a large British broadcasting corporation in West London, on an interminable Perl project later rewritten entirely in Flash. One of the few highlights of my days was interacting with MÃ¤ike [name changed to protect the innocent], a Senior Developer on a downstream part of the project.

item.title: Perl Developer who wants to learn Scala and NodeJS - West London
item.description: Love Perl but want to skill-up on another stack at your employerâ€™s expense? Client is a major and dynamics UK company with a large (and pretty Modern) Perl codebase who have started extended their technical stack to include Scala and NodeJS.

item.title: The Swiss Perl Workshop 2017
item.description: The Swiss Perl Workshop will be held in Villars-sur-Ollon on August 25-26. CFP is open until July 31, and registration is now open.

item.title: YAPC::Fukuoka
item.description: July 01, 2017, LINE Fukuokaæ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾, Hakata-Ku, Fukuoka, Japan

item.title: German Perl Workshop 2017
item.description: The German Perl Workshop is in Hamburg, at the BÃ¼rgerhaus Wilhelmsburg, on June 26-28! Registration is open!

item.title: The Perl Conference - US
item.description: Register now for the US Perl Conference (formerly YAPC::NA), June 18-23, near Washington, DC.

item.title: The Perl Conference - Amsterdam
item.description: Formerly YAPC::EU, the conference's theme this year is 'High-end Perl'. Call for Presentations remains open until June 15!

item.title: French Perl Workshop
item.description: The French Perl Workshop will be held in Paris Jun 9-10.

item.title: Madrid Perl Workshop
item.description: On June 3, 2017 in Madrid, Spain

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Crowdfunding the Bailador book
item.description: Gabor continues his crowdfunding campaign to write a book on Web Application Development in Perl 6. He has posted an article on launching the campaign and the first week of the campaign. Bailador now has a web site.

item.title: Perl 6 at a Glance as an e-book
item.description: The book is now available as a pdf as well.

item.title: The 'Think Perl 6' book is out
item.description:
The Think Perl 6 book is now officially out (see oreilly.com). O'Reilly received it from the printer this week and started shipping it out to retailers.
It is also available in PDF format as a free book under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.
Readers are free to copy and distribute the text; they are also free to modify it, which allows them to adapt the book to different needs, and to help develop new material. The LaTeX source for this book is in this Github repository.

item.title: YAP6B
item.description: The Perl 6 Weekly

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: May 17th to 22nd
item.description: A quiet week on the Perl 5 Porters list, apparently

item.title: Perl Toolchain Summit 2017
item.description: Joel attends his second Summit, and worked on the CPAN Test Reporter, along with a few other CPAN issues

item.title: My Perl Toolchain Summit
item.description: Sawyer fills us in on his second Summit

item.title: graphql-perl - a GraphQL reference implementation in Perl
item.description: Ed is porting GraphQL from JavaScript to Perl. He's got some initial findings on this daunting task!

item.title: No propsal for the European Perl Conference 2018 yet
item.description: Hopefully, some monger group steps up soon!

item.title: #305 - I thought summer was a slower time, when I was a kid...
item.description:
So, you missed the Toolchain Summit, eh? I didn't get to go, either, but there are still a bunch of conferences ahead! Plan now to go!

We're still getting in some reports from the Toolchain Summit, too, plus a few other goodies of news from around the net this week. My world's been a little busy, and it looks like some of the usual posters have been busy with other things, too!
